events.comment:
Author: Ulises Freitas
Version: 1.0.1
Yarnalia - An example of Yarn dialogs for GDevelop 5 with quests, object picking, openning of doors, custom avatar for NPCs and dialogs with options.
Change the animation according to what the player do.
events.comment2: On change l'animation en fonction de ce que fait le joueur.

events.comment: Make sure the camera follows the player.
events.comment2: On s'assure que la camra suit le joueur.

events.comment: when yuo take the Ashley quest a Switch will appear in front of the door just walk in and the door will open
When you success in the Ashley quest a yellow key will appear near the house

events.name: Golden door collision and Golden key

events.comment: If you collide with the golden door and you don't have the golden key nothing is going to happen, if you have the key the door will open.
Simple AI to move the king left/right when he collides with the ColliderNPC
Innitiate your dialogue data by loading it from a yarn json file
Here load the dialog data from the JSON file this file is under assets/ folder

When the scenes begin we load the dialogs from the JSON and Reset the timer "endedChat" so if is greater than 0.05 and the PlayerHitBox is in collision with a Sign the very first sign will start the dialog to make sure the Player knows which key use for start a dialog [Z] and move LEFT,RIGHT and Spacebar to Jump.
Start dialogue with an npc, the npc moves only when not chatting with the player
The TEXT type is what is rendered to the player to read. How that is presented depends on what expressions you use. Below is an exampleof the most common presentation with scrolling text
The [[OPTIONS]] type is whenever in your yarn syntax you are asking the player to make a choice. Below is a common example of showing the choices and triggering one
The <<COMMAND>> type can be used to trigger game events - such as changing an avatar picture to happen,parameter -1 is the name of the command where it came from, from there on it starts from 0
